TaxonIdentification.subspecies_authority: J. E. Keeley, M. C. Vasey & V. T. Parker

treatment.description: Twigs glandular-hairy. Leaf blades strongly white-glaucous, base rounded, sometimes ± lobed to truncate, surfaces scabrous, finely glandular-hairy or sparsely puberulent. Inflo-rescences: immature inflorescence axis densely white-hairy, eglan-dular; bracts densely white-hairy, eglandular. Pedicels densely white-hairy. Ovaries densely white-hairy. Fruits slightly depressed-globose. Stones distinct.
treatment.discussion: Subspecies leucophylla occurs from the Peninsular Range of California southward to northern Baja California.
